p.s: As stated in the summary, the speech by Barack Obama is about the positive consequences by doing a student exchange.

Right from the start, you can see Barack Obama's conviction towards the student exchange.
You directly see his positive view about the topic and because of that, the reader or listener also have a positive view about it.

The sentence In America, I'm proud to see a new spirit of activism and responsibility take root (l. 4) gives a good feeling that it works what he says and because of his positive radiation you woldwould like to read on.
With his speech Barack Obama will cheer especially young people up to do a student exchange.
It seems that he will encourage young people to come together with other countries and share experiences (ll. 13-14) for a better interaction in the holewhole world.
Because he talks about his own experiences he also makes young people courage to do a student exchange and meet therefore new people and the language (ll. 5-10).

You can see in the speech how important it is to Obama that as much as can travel around the world to learn much about the other parts of the world and interact with them for a better communication in the holewhole world (ll. 13-14).

His positive conviction and the appeal at the end of the extract about the topic in the holewhole speech gives the listener and reader a good feeling about was he says and let you thinking about doing a student exchange (ll. 18-22).
All in all you can say that he convinceconvinces the reader in a really positive way.
